Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HiawathaWales
Reviews.Content: We had the good luck to stay twice in this hotel The first time was for two nights en route to Sydney at the end of Jan. And three nights on our way back home at the begining of March. Our bedroom in Jan. was on the third floor.Large ,very clean ,very comfortable bed,electric controlled window blinds. Good size bathroom and well maintained. On our return we were upgraded ( not asked for )to a Suite. That was superb. I fail to understand some comments about the food. You name it ,and it was there for breakfast. The staff without exception were welcoming,approachable but special mention must be made of Madan Sharma who went "the extra mile". We look forward to returning and for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: David1K
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at feb/march 2012 in Dubai, staying in Marco Polo hotel and we were very satisfied with the services (for the price). The staff in the hotel was very VERY friendly, trying to help us in any needs. They provided us with kids bed for free (for 2 years daughter). Rich breakfast, good lunch and several restaurants to choose from for dinner were also very satisfying. They operate daily bus to the beach and back, provide you with towels for the beach and the free internet on the room is also very usefull. Thanks Marco!

Reviews.Title: “Really Basic for its Star Rating!”
Reviews.Author: Kamanza
Reviews.Content: I was unable to get a booking at my preferred hotel in Dubai and since this one was in the neighbourhood (Deira), I decided to give it a try! I was very disappointed with the bathrooms (you can easily break your neck in them, they are that small) and the breakfast buffet (very Spartan to an international clientèle). I didn't get value for my money in terms of comfort as well. My room in particular, had the TV in a very awkward position and you won't get your room cleaned until very late in the afternoon! Some room as amenities are for sale which should be inclusive like every other hotel in that area. Another let down was that they are almost directly under the flight path, so expect a lot of noise all day and night! However, they do have a variety of very acclaimed restaurants and they are priced fairly and rations are huge! My advice would be to stay somewhere else and go to the Marco Polo for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect them to have a room available when you get there!!”
Reviews.Author: Stevepsheffield
Reviews.Content: I am afraid I am not in a position to comment fully on this Hotel, only its lack of professionalism consideration and respect ,for myself and my young family. I can only warn prospective customers of the risks involved in entering into a contract and tell you our experiences in booking this Hotel. I booked and paid for a room for my family 5 weeks before arriving. I also arranged a hotel taxi pick up 2 weeks prior to flying. The Hotel had my mobile number and e-mail address. We were delayed by one hour and therefore sent a text to the hotel prior to boarding my flight informing them of this delay. When we arrived in Dubai at 2.30am we met our Driver (Prem) who promptly informed us there was no room available for us as they were over booked for that night, and we would have to stay in their sister hotel (Savoy Crest) for one night, then pack and move to the Marco Polo the following morning. You can appreciate our disgust at being told this news when all we wanted was to be given our pre booked beds in the hotel we had specifically chosen for our 2 night stay in Dubai. Prem called the duty manager who gave me a different reason for the lack of a room and promised that he would look after me when we arrived at the Marco Polo the following day. I was told there was plumbing problems in the room, so somebody was not telling the truth. I told him that this situation was not good enough and asked what would have happened if I had not booked a Hotel transfer and why had they not informed me before that they had sold my room to somebody else? I also had no idea of the standard of the hotel or room on offer. I had no option but to accept the situation and speak to them the following morning. The room at the alternative Hotel was clean and acceptable to us and out of principle I decided I would not be wasting any more time in moving the following day in what was effectively our only day in Dubai. I had a call from a different duty manager the following day and I told him we did not want to move and was not prepared to spoil my break any further by wasting any more time on the issue. I reminded him I was promised to be ‘looked after’ and after a little pushing on my part he gave us a complimentary lunch at the Savoy Crest, which we accepted. This episode still leaves a bitter taste in my mouth as you should be able to trust an accepted pre-paid booking. It is simply not good business practice to put customers through this situation when they have travelled over 3000 miles and send them (including my 12 year old daughter) to a hotel in what I later found to be one of Dubais red light areas (Mankool).We had our holiday plans ruined immediately on arrival (I even had to have The Entertainer magazine re-routed to our new hotel). I hope as a result of people reading this they lose business over this issue as we were badly let down by this hotel and its management. P.S The driver (Prem) and the Indian Savoy Crest driver were professional and treated us all very well at all times in the circumstances, and I personally would like to thank them for their professionalism, hospitality and understanding. P.P.S. I would strongly reccomend the Savoy Crest Hotel as their staff were ecxellant from start to finish and did everything to accomodate us during our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stop over for a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: Brumer
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Was nice and close to the airport but had no airport noise, so that was great. Rooms were very spacious and beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. Service was fantastic as was breakfast. We met a tour booking lady from Arabian Adventures at 9am in the foyer to organize us on our Desert Safari tour that afternoon.....perfectly seamless! Would most certainly stay here again. Perfect location and price. Bought our Big Bus Tour tickets at reception and changed Aussie cash there too without any problems. Staff were fantastic! lLoved it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir N
Reviews.Content: together with friends we have at the end of January and February 2012 spent 8 nights at the Marco Polo. The hotel offers reasonably priced quality service with very friendly service and very good selection of restaurants with evening program. If you are looking for a good location, quality and reasonable price so we can only recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Location Great staff”
Reviews.Author: JW2507
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11th -22nd January,2012. We found the staff to be very helpful and always polite and cheerful. The Hotel was very comfortable clean and well maintained. The buffet breakfast was excellent and catered for all tastes. The selection of restaurants in the hotel is varied and in particular the Bombay was one of the best Indian restaurants we have eaten in both for the food and the entertainment.The Palm Grove was good for coastal Indian cuisine and the Chopstix for Chinese food.There are nightclubs and frequent functions going on but we never found them to be noisy or obtrusive.The hotel is situated in a busy part of Deira and there are dozens of restaurants all within 10 minutes walk.The Metro is 5 minutes walk away and an excellent way of getting around.There are two shopping malls within 10 minutes walk and plenty of small shops nearby. The Gardens running along the road in front of the hotel are lovely for an evenings stroll and people watching.Their Polo Lounge is an excellent place to relax and chill out after a days activities.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in Deira”
Reviews.Author: visitors2011-2
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 5 nights. Good location in Deira with easy access to several restaurants and shopping places. Staff were helpful to make your stay comfortable and tried their best to meet your requests. Room was spacious, clean, modern and well equipped. the only disadvantage is the noise of the planes while the hotel is almost under the air take off route, which not much residents or hotels can avoid. Over all, it was a good and pleasant stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mwbarnes
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Dubai and we were not disappointed. We were initially a bit wary as we had heard a lot of stories about the place and what you could and couldn’t do, but providing you are sensible there shouldn’t be any problems and we certainly didn’t encounter any. The hotel Marco Polo was modern, very comfortable and reasonably close to the airport although directly under the flight path. Having said that the planes did not cause any problem with noise etc. Rooms were well appointed with Kettle (tea & coffee etc supplied), hairdryer, safe (free), Internet access, mini bar and electric window blinds ! (Fun to play with !) Within the hotel are several eating places, including a so called English style pub (Food and service here were excellent), Indian, Chinese, Filipino and Mexican restaurants also. There is also a Disco/nightclub on the premises but we didn’t use it. We were there on a Bed & breakfast basis and found the breakfast to be excellent with plenty of choice. All the hotel staff were very attentive, helpful and polite. Getting around was reasonably easy. There are plenty of taxi’s (Government owned so all taxi’s are metered and reasonably priced) and there is also a Metro system although we didn’t try it. Buses are also frequent and the Hotel Marco Polo runs a courtesy bus several times a day to limited locations. Would we go to Dubai again and stay at the Marco Polo hotel ? – Most definitely !!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderfull time in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Boy-Nellie
Reviews.Content: We got a warm welcome with a refreshing drink. We got a free upgrade of our room and the room was available early in the morning. We were 10 nights at this hotel in November 2011. All the staff is very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast buffet was very good. We were disapointed about the swimming pool, you have no view, only high walls and just a little bit of sun. The hotel is located near to the new metro and taxi is always available. Free shuttle bus to Deira City Centre and to the beach (with towels).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: like24
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Marco Polo Hotel. Staff Excellent. Beyond expectations. We had a double room which was magnificent. Severel restaurants to choose from in the Evening and i do recommend the English Bar. Only downside in the English Bar was the Entertainment....was vertually the same two night running

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John491
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights (Sept. 2011) at the Marco Polo Hotel. The staff were excellent, polite and very helpful. The room was clean and more than adequate as was the breakfast they provided. The only down side I would mention is that the hotel is located in the older part of Dubai and therefore some distance from the airport and the shopping malls. Having said that, the taxi's are very cheap extremely available.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend by Marhaba, red-eyed at the airport at 7am. Here are the PROs and CONs.”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasedSoul
Reviews.Content: We were offered this place by Marhaba Services (Airport; 2 day layover). The PROs and the CONs: PROs: - the location is in a REAL area (not Disney Dubai) where you can walk 6-7 minutes to metro's green line (and a mall on Salahuddin street), supermarkets everywhere, an outstanding Baghdad restaurant 5 minutes (East on Al Muteen) and plenty of shopping for nuts, dates, fast food (Arab style) around. It's an eclectic area for Arabs, Philipinos, and Pakistanis, with some cafes with side walk seating where you can watch a non-touristy Dubai walk by. Nice palms and Boardwalk there as well. -Rooms are cozy, quirky (secret panels, creative storage space, electronic blinds). -the guests really range (EU families, Indian families, young Asian businessmen, Yank contractors on their way to Bagram or Iraq, few Russians, etc...) despite the hotel really having an Indian-centric focus (restaurants are Keralan, Indian, and Chinese). - the staff are nearly just as varied as the guests. -there's a karaoke bar and some club thing. -there's a variety of channels (only English news channels are CCTV from China and CNN... which extreme are you in the mood for?) including some good movie channels but I don't think any sport ones. -there's all night room service (menu's good enough... about 20 items, standard clb sandwiches, etc) - the breakfast (oriental) to the room was amazing. Labneh, Fatouleh, Lebanese bread... great coffee. -I think all rooms have bathtubs. -the service is really genuine and efficient. -It's one of the old cats (16 years) in Dubai, and you feel like the staff have all been there a while and enjoy working there. -the reception and the concierge (they call it "hospitality desk") went above and beyond in scanning and emailing my docs, calling beaches for costs and travel plans, river dinner, gold and spice souqs.. etc). They just get it done and their slogan on their pins "Yes, I can" seems to always be met. -there's a gym. -It's clean. -Excellent bed, covers, and pillows. Really new, soft, and fresh. Also, the completely dark blinds (electric, fully closed and thick) add to the sleep. -Steady and not-dry AC. -there's a buffet breakfast every morning (we didn't try it). - the restaurants seem to have good looking food, and nice atmospheres. -taxi is 25 Dhs (7$) to Dubai Mall and 20 mins, every taxi driver knows the Marco Polo. -they picked us up from the airport and dropped us off (no extra cost). -they allowed early check-in (8am!). -shazzam. CONs: -the rooms facing into the open atrium are odd (even claustrophobic, so make sure you see a room first), but they're pretty funky. - room had smokey smell when we entered (108)... check before. - the pool is small, only gets sun after 4pm - surrounded by high walls. There are some sunbeds though. It also closes pretty early (not sure of time). - you need to pay for amenities in the bathroom (toothbrush, buds, etc) but not shampoo of course. All in all, I'd give it 3.5 stars, but a 4.5 for service; I'd say it's worth 80-100$ a night (I have no idea what we paid), or maybe less if Dubai's bubble re-bursts.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star, not 4, but there is Internet”
Reviews.Author: xuxiake
Reviews.Content: The hotel is claimed as 4 star but based on hundreds of hotels I have stayed, I would put it as a 2.5 star hotel. The room is small and the restroom is smaller than average. It's only 5 square meters including the tub. The caulking in the restroom turns to black. The best thing about this hotel is the free Internet which does not exist for all other hotels I stayed in Dubai. The Salah Al Din green line metro station is 400 meters away. Because of the accessibility and the Internet, I still would give this hotel a four-star rating. In general, Dubai hotels do not offer Internet and the Internet is very expensive. The price is generally very high compared to the US or East Asia.

Reviews.Title: “ripp off, not good at all, old and crappy”
Reviews.Author: wibo70
Reviews.Content: was last week one night in this hotel, never again, old, crappy and far too expensive .....i later moved to Intercontinental Festival City : cheaper and a 5 star experience !

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotels”
Reviews.Author: gpodar
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, nothing too fancy in terms of decor but supreb tech. Everything in the room like the curtains, music, room temperature can be controlled from the bedside table. Extremely clean and has a nice contempary sleek look. Nice place to stay if you are looking to spend most of your time sightseeing and shopping and need a good reasonable hotel. Also noteworthy is the breakfast spread, realy good food.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars?”
Reviews.Author: ianadrienne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel, booked by Emirates at their suggestion. At first we were offered a dim internal room which was supposedly a non-smoking room but smelt of smoke and felt claustrophobic. We asked for a change and could only be offered a room with twin beds which we grudgingly accepted. Like other guests, we also never had hot water in our shower for the whole time we were there. It is definitely a rundown hotel and we agree the bathroom is small and quality of workmanship in grouting the tiles leaves a lot to be desired. The staff were very friendly and helpful but we had to ask for more coffee sachets and toilet paper as housekeeping was a little slack. Meal at Bombay Restaurant was a winner and didn't feel the price of alcohol was too expensive. All in all, I guess we were disappointed at the size of the hotel, the pool in the shade and the whole experience considering it was supposedly a four star hotel. Next time we would go for something more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: sarita1_07
Reviews.Content: memorable stay. Excellent service.Very helpful staff. we just look forward another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable Hotel Not Far From Airport.”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in this hotel and would definately stay there again, It was in a good location, was spotlessly clean and the beds were the most comfortable in our entire 5 week holiday. Many restaurants to choose from with tasty food. Breakfast really fresh with a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very pleasant to stay and would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: ArunBhaskar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my brief stay in Dubai as advised by some known people to me in Dubai. The entire online booking process was as easy as anything. Exhange of few emails and the booking was confirmed and I was able to make payment only when I reached the hotel. I have stayed at many hotels in other countries like Thailand and Malaysia and it was as good as I could get in Malaysia or in some ways better than in this price range. The room was good, neat and clean with good ambience. The surprise was jacuzzi in the bathroom. We really enjoyed it. The breakfast is good and for Indians one can find Sarvana Bhavan for South Indian food is nearby. Added adavange was complimentary pick-up and drop at the Dubai Int'l Airport. We really thank you very much for hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wilko87
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly hotel. We stayed for 3 days in July 2011 and apart from a slight mix up with our reservation due to our arrival time (1.15am) we found this hotel to be very friendly. Unfortunately my better half was ill with a bug picked up in Europe and the hotel arranged a Doctor who was there within the hour and supplied medication later that day, during this time the staff particularly Devika went out their way to help us both and always asked how Madam was feeling. Devika arranged a 4 hour of Dubai via a air-condition limo at a very reasonable rate so that we didn't miss out on the sights of Dubai. We stayed in one of the Marco Polo suites which was an excellent room with all the amenities you could ask for including free hi speed internet. Once again an excellent hotel with great staff. Would recommend. Wilko

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is really recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Dianevangeffen
Reviews.Content: The Marco Polo Hotel in Dubai is a great hotel. The rooms are very clean and in good shape. They look smooth and stylish. When you are with 2 persons you have enough space and also with 3 persons in one room there is enough space. There is a bar in the hotel but the prices for alcohol are really high. There is swimmingpool, which had a good service, you got towels and a bed. The breakfast is good, a lot of fresh fruits, all kinds of warm food, lot of bread and drinks, the service was good. The personel was really friendly, all our questions were anwsered good. The location is good on a 10 minute walk there is the metro station union square but there also is a free shuttle express from the hotel to union square metro. There also is a free shuttle express to the Jumeirha Beach in the morning. There are a lot of shops, supermarket and restaurants on this street were the hotel is located. It is a busy street but you not really notice that inside the hotel. There is also Wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Brush1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed previously at this hotel so when we chose to return to Dubai we again stayed at the Marco Polo. The rooms are nice, the staff very good, we had one evening meal at the hotel resturant and enjoyed it. Breakfast is more eastern style food (as you would expect) not bad just different. Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Dubai and not wishing to spend a huge amount on the many upmarket hotels that are available.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal hotel to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: RohitTuteja
Reviews.Content: I was in Dubai with my wife and daughter and we stayed at the Marco Polo Hotel. The hotel rooms have just been refurbished and the rooms look very new and amazing. The hotel is very close to the airport and almost the centre of all the places to visit in Dubai. The hotel has a daily free shuttle to the Al Mamzar Park & Beach, which is a nice placeto relax. The staff is very very friendly and if you are an Indian, you wont feel away from home. They took great care of us. Speaking about food - the Bombay restaurnat serves some amazing Indian food with a soothing ambience. We had a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Prefectly good hotel for a stopover / short break”
Reviews.Author: lil-miss-sunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marco Polo from 13th - 16th March for a 3 day stopover on our way to Sri Lanka. Its not too far from the airport (about 20 mins by car) so is quite convenient. We arrived at about 8am and were able to get into our room more or less straight away which was good after an overnight flight. Staff were very nice & helpfull. Our room was nice enough, quite modern with a large flat screen t.v and really comfy queen size bed. The Bathroom was quite small, it was ready for a bit of a re-do as the grouting round the bath etc and the decor had seen better days, it was very clean though & the shower was really powerfull and we had plenty of hot water. We had asked for a room away from the nightclub as we had read on some reviews that you get the noise late at night, we were granted this and got a room at the back overlooking the pool. However we got aircraft noise as its on the landing / take off route - not a major problem if you have earplugs which luckily we did so so pack some - the aircraft noise goes on through the night. The pool gets hardly any sun so this is not the ideal hotel if you intend to lay round the pool getting a tan, the pool is nice though and the sunlungers round it are comfy so its very pleasant to just sit out and read there for an hour. Pool towels are provided. We ate in the Fox & Hounds Pub in the hotel on our last evening, the food was nice and is reasonably priced, alcohol is quite expensive (by UK standards ) I believe thats pretty much the norm in Dubai though. They do have offers on drinks but we were out and about most of the time so only went in the bar for a nightcap and the one meal. Breakfast was nice, plenty to choose from. By Dubai standards the Marco Polo is probalby not the flashest hotel, however for what we wanted (a busy 3 day stopover) it was perfectly good. Its about 10 / 15 minutes walk from Union Square metro station which is an ok walk if its not too hot so from that point of veiw its very convenient. It cost us less than £5 for 2 all day metro tickets. If we went to Dubai again we would probalby just go there for or 5 so days (not as part of a stopover) in which case we would problaby choose a more prestegious hotel in the central area, however if we were on a flying visit or another stopover we would be happy to stay at the Marco Polo again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: amor_estrela
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here. The rooms are trendy, very modern, clean and properly maintained. Beds are very comfortable; bathroom & kitchenette is very convenient. I stayed for 5 days and am very happy with the overall service. Staff is warm, helpful & guided us with sightseeing & modes of transport in Dubai. Restaurant is very nice, I enjoyed the buffet breakfast. Room service is very good. Minor hiccups:- I wish the hotel would provide good exchange rates like in the malls. Also, the hotel should provide all day free shuttle service to Metro Station, just makes it convenient for tourists. I will totally stay there again & recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: livinginthetropics
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent customer service. I was very impressed with the rooms and the facilities. would definitely stay there again! The only thing i was not impressed with was I got food poisoning on my second night at the hotel after eating at the chinese restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOW1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights as part of a longer holiday, Hotel very welcoming, we arrived at 08.00hrs and were given our room straight away and told that as we were leaving early on the last day we could go for breakfast then instead. Breakfast very nice. Rooms lovely, bed very comfortable, bathroom ok have had better but the rest of the hotel really made up for it. Pub in hotel very nice, Hi to Maria who was lovely and really made our stay. Indian restaurant excellent. Hotel a bit out of town but taxis really cheap, Dubai is amazing, lots to do and see. Swimming pool really warm but doesn't seem to get much sun, We only swam at teatime so don't know about through the day. Would definately reccomend this hotel and would stay there again. Didn't experience any noise from disco or refurbishments.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: gregw01
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Marco Polo, on a short stopover. It was excellent value for money; my room was probably not one of the refurbished rooms, but was still very comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly and efficient. I had dinner at the in-house Chinese restaurant which was excellent. Minor gripes: my room did not have internet access; towels are in need of replacement. Great restaurants in the vicinity (mainly Indian, and really great value). All in all good value for money, high standards of comfort and service and an OK location. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: bassil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marco Polo for a couple of nights on our way to Europe in September 2010. We have previously been to Dubai and next time we would definitely not stay at the Marco Polo. They are renovating at the moment and we were given a room that had not been renovated and there were rooms being renovated on our floor so sometimes quite noisey. Even had a couple of cockroaches in the bathroom. The staff don't smile that often, exept for the doormen who were always friendly and smiling. The location is not the best, not near any shopping centres etc. though taxis are not that expensive. The Hotel does look good from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , specially the food and the tour arrangements.”
Reviews.Author: BiplabKolkata
Reviews.Content: It was excellent specially thge food be it Indian or Chinese. Their tour arrangement and personal / individual attention require separate mention. We would like to name the gentlemen Mr Milon Rozario, Executive Chef and Mr Madan Sharma, Asst Front Office Manager who made everything possible to make our trip success. Cheers !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rbnair
Reviews.Content: Just a ten minute drive from the airport, this hotel offers value for money. The staff are friendly, the restaurants are highly rated. Their major drawback however is the lobby which is extremely small. However this is clearly offset by the complimentary airport pick up and drop service, besides free internet in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but it needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Birchyk
Reviews.Content: The Marco Polo is rated 4 star & I believe that is because of the services they offer, which are very good, with number of restaurants on site, disco, pool, gym & the like. The rooms themselves are well equiped with large flat sceen TV with many English language chanels, Safe, Fridge (which even turned down fully is not that cold) large room with desk & chairs with a small table. The bathroom is of average size but needs updating or repairing. Our room (306) had most of the fittings hanging off the wall loosley as someone had made the attempt to fix them but failed. A tap was leaking & pooling on the floor when we arrived which was fixed quickly once we notified staff. The lace type curtains in the room had stains on them obviously needing a good wash. The room itself reminded me a lot of good quality Bali room. The breakfast was ample with a wide range to choose from although the covers on all the chairs were filthy & desperatly needed changing. The hotel privide a shuttle bus to the local Metro twice in the morning & to a nearby beach, yet other hotels I believe have a more extensive shuttle service to the malls etc. As Dubai is always hot it is hard to get around in comfort other than a taxi from this hotel. We used the metro which is great once you are in there but it is about 1klm walk from the hotel. Bus service is also has A/C & is good, although hard to work out, but is a much slower mode of travel due to all the stops. The staff at the hotel were fantastic answering all our requests with a smile & effectively. No issues with any of them at all. In all the stay was good but could have been better if the hotel provided that better shuttle service that others do. They also need to address the standard of their upkeep of the rooms. We did not try the restaurants other than the breakfast room as we were out each night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: nagdeep
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city, this is a beautiful 4 star hotel, which truly lives up to its expectations. The staff is warm and hospitable. The room is amazingly clean and well maintained. Room service is good. They have a couple of restaurants but they are quite expensive. On the negative side, they neither provide free airport transfers, nor do they have any free shuttles to any of the prominent locations unlike most other hotels in that area... How ever, It is a total value for money, and I shall surely stay again / recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “super hospitality and warmth.....”
Reviews.Author: suruchisethia
Reviews.Content: dont know where to begin.after reading some bad reviews about this place i was sceptical about this hotel but i found this hotel simply superb.to begin with,we reached the hotel at 6.30 am and the check in time was 2pm but they immediately gave us a room,i mean so early and fast without any hesitation.and to top it they upgraded us to a superior room which was very big and even had a jacuzi in the bathroom.although the bathing area could be a little better.even when we were checking out,they gave us a late check out of 4 pm.they were very accomodating about this which most hotels are not. there is an indian restaurant,bombay with amazing food,service and live music.it is a must visit even if u r not staying in this hotel. the breakfast was very nice and tasty.lot of choices for vegetarians as well.the manager of the restaurant as well as other staff were very hospitable and took good care while having breakfast.there was a personal touch in everything. i had very good sleep and did not face any loud music problem.taxis are readily available on the doorstep besides which the hotel provides free shuttle to the beach and metro station which is very convinient.on the opposite foot just a 5 mins walk are lots of indian and south indian restaurants. to end it i would like to really appreciate the front desk reception staff who are so warm and always so helpful and smiling.i cant thank them enough for my wonderful stay.they even got me superb deals for the sand safari and guided me about shopping,transportation and about everything. marco polo is a small hotel,defenitely not 5 star but there service bowls you away.i would like to recommend to stay here.for the price u cant get better.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: josh4amit
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hotel as i was impressed with their services during my first stay. However, this time that charm was lacking and this stay proved to be an ordinary one. The biggest attraction of this hotel is its restaurant the Bombay, which is really a hit due to its excellent food and great Indian music. This is a must visit for Indians who are around and are looking for a bite. The rooms are quite average and the furniture and other stuff is not properly maintained. The services are also average as there is no proper management. However, as we were staying for 4 days in the Hotel, the Hotel did provided us with complimentary pick and drop facility from the Airport. The rooms are quite small and not well maintained and needs some improvement and renovation. The location is also not that great and there is practically nothing which is close to the Hotel. Overall, i will rank this Hotel as Average but give full regards to the Food and Music. You can avoid if you do not have planned transportation. But given the price you pay, it a decent accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good night sleep, do NOT stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn S
Reviews.Content: While the service from the staff was good, there is a DISCO on the main floor that will keep you awake until about 03:30. When we complained of the noise we were told they would ask them to lower the volume, but there was no change. The next day we were moved to a "quiet" room, but he pounding of the music was still very bad. As I told the management, this establishment has to decide if it wants to be a Disco or a Hotel, they can not be both. On the positive side, upon returning to our room after a long day we found that room service had left a complimentary cake for my birthday, which they noticed was that day.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: siddatta
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, not overly expensive but not cheap either. If one is planning a family trip this would be a good place to stay as it has a fine choice of dining and is close to most of the tourist attractions in the city. Over all a pretty great hotel to spend a week or so at.

Reviews.Title: “The staff here know nothing about service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozandy
Reviews.Content: We landed in Dubai at around 2.00am from Nairobi and after waiting for our priority baggage for an hour we finally cleared immigration and customs and got a cab to the Marco Polo. We arrived just after 4.00am gave them our voucher and waited for our room allocation and key. The gentleman, and I use the word loosely, said you can't check in until 2.00pm. I said I am only here for 16 hours so what is the issue. He said your voucher says todays date and that I could still not check in until 2.00pm. I asked him what the occupancy rate was and he said about 50%. I suggested he use his commonsense and allocate us a room as we had been travelling all day and just wanted to sleep and we would not be using the breakfast voucher as would be sleeping through. He became agitated and said this was not possible and that we would have to pay another 550 Dirhams (approx AUD$200) or we would have to go away and come back at 2.00pm! This was supposed to be a 4star hotel and I again suggested he show some sensible management skills but this guy had absolutely no flexibility so I was forced to pay the extra money or have nowhere to stay. The room was very basic with none of the plumbing fixtures fitting or covering the holes in the wall, a great place for vermin to live and breed. The bathroom had been poorly cleaned and the room had a fairly dank smell. Sort of stuff you might expect in a 2 star hotel or backpackers. We packed up at 8.00pm the same day and left. I went to the front counter to pay for the couple of drinks we had from the mimi bar and we were met ther by the manager who wanted to shout us a cup of tea or coffee to apologise for the inconvenience we had been put through. I told him that no amount of tea or coffee would compensate us for what had happened. I told him that we had stayed in many hotels and that his was 3rd rate and would struggle to get any more than 2.5stars anywhere in the world. I also told him that he understood nothing about service or management and that it was easy to understand where his staff got their attitudes from. I also told him that I would write a review for trip advisor and would tell everybody I know of how we had been treated.

Reviews.Title: “Stay spoilt by RUDE manager”
Reviews.Author: Misty1937
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as a stopover from Venice to Australia. Our room was clean and large, bathroom small but adequate. It was pretty remote and not within walking distance of anything of interest. The first morning our shower curtain fell down while my friend was in the shower. There were no marks on the tiles whatsoever so it would appear the rod was slightly larger than the opening and had just been wedged there. We told the houseboy who said he would get it fixed but never did. As a result the bathroom was flooded when we took our showers the next morning. When we came down after breakfast for our 7am pick up we were not even allowed to put our luggage into the car until they had checked our room. Time went on and on so I put the luggage out myself. The driver was told not to go and I asked what the problem was as we hadn't used anything from the mini bar. The manager accused us of opening a bottle of water and demanded we pay. I offered to go to the room myself with him to show him we hadn't opened it but he flatly refused and told me to pay. I insisted he check again as I did not take kindly to being accused of stealing or his attitude. After 15 mins I was really cross and insisted he ring the housekeeper in the room again which he did and then I heard him say quietly "it hasn't been opened" into the phone. He hung up and muttered sorry to me but I told him he had insulted and offended me and I did not accept his muttered apology before leaving for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lifeless!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover82Bath
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine! The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean but very small! I just think it would be a shame to stay in this lifeless hotel that has no wow factor when you are in the capital of fantastic hotels!! There are many restaurants with good choice, the pool is ok, the gym is ok! Everything is just ok and probably will fade into my memory as just a bit lacking!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: RdCurtisJr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few weeks at the Marco Polo and found it very acceptable. They were very busy at that time but were able to help me stay for an extra week. The room was clean and modern, the staff was more than helpful and did everything they could to make my stay a true pleasure. It is located downtown and it was good for my needs as I had to travel to several different areas. I will stay there on my next trip to Dubai. They had several good restaurants as well, good food and the price was reasonable. You can walk to many nice stores and interesting places. I found that it was very safe to walk around day or night.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with all amenities”
Reviews.Author: mmatange
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in Dubai, good location, nice amenities with big rooms and all facilities. Also has disco.

Reviews.Title: “There is only one problem”
Reviews.Author: ferdinandGermany
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Marco Polo as a stop-over on our way to Australia. We arrived around 6 am and were very pleased that our room was ready immediately. The staff was in an amiable way very friendly and we greatly enjoyed the lavish breakfast. Our room on the top floor was spacious, the beds comfortable. On the down side the carpet came off in spots and there were moldy corners in the bathroom. But, this would not have bothered us too much. The real problem was the noise from the disco and the function rooms on the second night which lasted from 23:00 to around 3:00 am. I have never before heard such tremendous noise, even our heavy duty earplugs were of little help.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HATED IT!”
Reviews.Author: briiliiant
Reviews.Content: *** I would rate this hotel as a dismal POOR. It is undoubtedly the WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN and I would never stay there again. 1. Internet is charged at a full hour rate (AED 10) even for 5 minutes check of an email. The internet area is in a dining area and food can be placed out around you when at the PC. 2. Check out efficiency was the worst I have ever encountered. The clerk needed to ring the room service to check the mini-bar while we waited for 20 minutes 3. We had ordered and pre-paid for a triple room WHICH WAS NOT PREPARED ON ARRIVAL. After eventually getting one trundle rollaway, which had to be sent back because it was soiled, the second eventually collapsed in the middle of the night. Reception transferred us next morning at 7 am to a room with 3 distinct beds. Then we had to organize for triple toiletries, towels, extra cups, coffee and water. 4. The alarm went off at 3:45 am on the first night having been preset by the previous tenants. 5. The Air Conditioning did not work, nor could we open our windows. IT WAS NOT FIXED FOR OUR 5 NIGHT STAY! 6. THE LIGHT SWITCH NEXT TO THE DESK HAD EXPOSED COPPER WIRING THROUGH THE TORN INSULATION. This was an extreme electrical safety hazard. 7. Breakfast was absolutely boring and repetitive being essentially INDIAN in cuisine. The sitar player each morning was irritating. Scrambled eggs were repeatedly runny and I actually saw chefs handling waffles with their bare hands. Coffee always ran out. 11. American Express traveler's cheques are converted at a VERY low rate compared to money exchangers outside.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: andricScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is decorated in a wonderful Arab style and provides a very pleasant introduction. The rooms are fairly basic, but clean and comfortable. There is a good bar and nice restaurants on site. The location however does not have anything of interest within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: missy_greyhound
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Marco Polo for one night while waiting for my friend to arrive on an early morning flight from Australia. I booked at a tourist desk in the airport late at night after my flight from London. I explained that I just needed a single room for one night and to be near the hotel I had booked for my stay with my friend for the following 3 days. It only cost me around £60 and it was close to the airport in a taxi. Upon arrival at reception I was greeted with a glass of fresh juice and a cold towel. The reception staff were very pleasant. I was taken to my room on the top floor and was pleasantly surprised by the room. Not modern decor by any means but clean, comfortable and with a huge bed. The bathroom looked as though it had had a face lift and the shower was great. There was some noise from the bar/disco downstairs but it was not too loud and had stopped by midnight. The next morning I had breakfast which was included in my rate. It was ok but just ok. I have been to a lot better but for the money what can you expect? If you have booked this hotel for a holiday then I think you will have a good stay. It is a good budget option for Dubai and the staff are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: dpcblack
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend in Jan 2008. The hotel is not 4 star, as advertised. It is located close to the airport (15 min), in Deira and as a business hotel is not too bad. Hotel was quite clean, modern and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Several rooms have plumbing problems. However the real problems start when the music starts at around 11pm and ends around 3am. It is too loud, you cannot go to sleep. Breakfast is OK and the tex-mex restaurant is of good quality and service

Reviews.Title: “Noisy disaster in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: AD-CY
Reviews.Content: at first i read on how good the hotel was for a lot of people. Then i read on how bad it was from others. Then i had no choice from my travel agent, and unfortunately we ended up there. Do NOT make that mistake, unless you are deaf, or you are very very lucky and you end up on the top floor. If you have another choice, take your chances with that. hotel has nice people, nice restaurants, adequate bathroom, but for us it was a disaster because: 1- we reserved a double-bed, and got 2 single mini beds (i am only 1.73 meters tall, and couldnt fit inside) 2- the room from 1030 up until 3 in the morning has so much noise from the below bar/parties/whatever that you cannot sleep, unless you use earbuds 3- hot water run out just after a short shower of 7-8 minutes, and next one had to shower in cold water. we did not comfront them with this since we thought it was only for the first time. Then it prooved to be for the whole duration of the stay. 4- internet was so slow most of the time i could not use it for work 5- the first night we came in at 1am from the airport, the room was not ready (where it should have been from 2PM!), there was no towels, no blankets, aircondition at MAX with freezing temperatures. We were so tired, we ended up trying to sleep with the noise, cold shower, and the works, only to sleep at 5 am and to wake up with a cold 3 hours later. 6- the whole 1st floor really smells indian food. the first night disasters were corrected (gradually) in the next 2 days, but still we could not rest, or take a hot shower, which are the only 2 reasons you rent a room really... The only positives: good people, had no problem with anyone, and good restaurant, would recomend the chinese restaurant. But that are not enough to even move the slider from terrible to okay... go for another one, or take your earbuds, and prepare to argue for something better... have a nice vacation AD

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: LancashireSam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our way back from Aus for 2 nites. Hotel was very clean, quite modern and the staff were great, very friendly and helpful, no probs whatsoever. The room was excellent, well furnished with mini bar, television etc. The bathroom was clean and had everything you could need including shampoo etc. The breakfast was very good and plentiful and there was hot food as well as cold. The hotel bar was cheap and well stocked. We ate here both days for lunch and evening meal and could find no fault with the food or the staff at all. The prices were cheap and there was even live entertainment in th evenings. We went on a city tour from the hotel which I would strongly recommend and again, it was only something like £10 pp. If I had to go back to Dubai I would stay at the hotel again, although the hotel was nice, Dubai didn't do anything for me or my husband at all and we wouldn't like to stay over any longer than we did. But, all in all, nice hotel, nice staff and good, cheap food.

Reviews.Title: “bad service, rude staff, overpriced - avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerSussex
Reviews.Content: Tarvel lots all over the world. This is NOT what I would expect from a four star hotel at this price. Kept waiting 3 hours to book into a room. Staff ignored me and were quite rude. Breakfast was quite a disater - 45 minute wait for an omlete - pilot at the next table blew because he had been waiting so long he had to leave without breakfast! Only saving grace was its location but I'd say avoid this hotel at all costs unless you get a VERY VERY cheap room!

Reviews.Title: “Week in Marco Polo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not four star. I stayed here for a week during August 2007. The staff are great and always very courteous but the location is not the best. In order to get to the Jumeira beach you have to take a taxi journey which lasts at least 40 minutes as the traffic is heavy at all times. My room was clean and comfortable but there was a night club to the rear that was open every night and I found it impossible to get to sleep most nights. I would recommend this hotel as a stop off point but not for the duration of your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai stopover”
Reviews.Author: europhileAustralia
Reviews.Content: Good service from kind staff and a comfortable bed made our stay very pleasant.We had jetlag after the flight from Australia and recovered well due to good blackout curtains allowing good afternoon sleep. Room clean and good size with good storage, iron and facilties. Bathroom finish and fittingscould have been better as could have the intructions for use of the pulsating multiple showerheads. Breakfast was terrific- choices included Indian, Middle Eastern and Western food. Plentiful buffet regularly topped up with attentive staff- we were Polo guests- some sort of upgrade we think but did not seem to make any difference apart from sitting in a seperate area at breakfast and having a constant presence of a helpful gentleman outside our door in the foyer of our floor. Would go back again when visiting Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauracarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on our way home from Sri Lanka. The reviews on here did worry us but once we arrived we were very pleased. Even though it is classed as a 4* I would say the room we had was no higher then a 3*. It was clean and well presented, however the fixtures and fittings were not neatly finished. This is of course me being very picky. The bed was very comfy and we found the hotel to be quiet in the evening. The breakfast I thought was great, plenty to choose from and well laid out. The pubs had good live music and give free snacks, which is a nice little extra. There are plenty of places to eat out next to the hotel, which is useful when only paying for b&b. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to various locations at certain times of the day. You will have to get a taxi on return but it only cost us about £1.50 from the local mall. The Deira City Centre Mall is a good shopping mall, with loads of designer shops and more. However, we would have liked to have gone to Jamierah shopping and to the water centre but it would have cost us quite a bit by taxi. The traffic is busy all the time and the taxis are on a meter so therefore may be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: susandavis
Reviews.Content: Having read the trip advisor reviews we were not holding out much hope for this hotel but on arrival we changed our tune. Admittedly it is not in the best part of town but there is a courtesy bus to the beach each day and taxis are very cheap so getting to the shopping malls etc is not a problem. The snack bar had a really good menu and the food was beautifully presented and very tasty. The "English Pub" was clean but without any atmosphere, there was never anybody in it! Breakfast was very good with a wide choice of dishes. The only downside is the pool area which in itself is very pleasant but it does not get the sun at all so even when it is hot everywhere else it is too cold to go in the pool. This hotel was great for a two day stay and close to the airport for the impossibly early flight! Do the big bus tour and take a ride on a Dhow - very relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about location”
Reviews.Author: davidandhannah
Reviews.Content: We were moved to Marco Polo without travel agent telling us, so we had know idea what to expect. Hotel room fine, clean, big TV. Breakfast limited, considering it is classed as four star. has small swimming pool, walled in, therefore only sunny for a short time. Location seemed to be in the Iraqi quarter as all local restaurants were Iraqi. We tried one, cant remember name, but they cooked fish on a circular indoor fire, which you can see from outside, and we a monster and very delicious meal, easily enough for 4 people. No 19 bus takes you from outside hotel to Gold Souk, very cheap, but also taxis were cheap, no journey more than £4. Best thing to do - get taxi to Wafi City to catch BIg Bus Tour, you get a city tour, a beach tour, and boat trip, all for £20 - brill - withh enough tine to get off at some of the stops. We are happy to provide any info at dtarsky at tesco.net

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvofholidays
Reviews.Content: The Marco polo was a fantastic hotel for the three nights we stayed. The room was clean, the bed was comfy and we found the staff to be very friendly (Had good bathroom goodies as well- exfoliating scub etc). I was worried about other comments regarding the noise factor of this hotel, however we didn't hear any noise that was disturbing. If you listened hard you could hear a faint noise of the planes going over but it certainly was faint. The area had great food. We enjoyed this section of Dubai as it's in the older section (still not very old!!!)and seemed to be cheaper in the food department and are not far from the gold markets. We also booked our tours from the lobby of the hotel. I really recommend a desert safari trip and the water park was great too. We caught a taxi 's everywhere and they are very well priced. Our stay at Marco Polo was excellent and I can't find anything to complain about this lovelly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickeyM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marco Polo in May on a 2 day stopover from Sri Lanka back to England. Our first impression of the hotel was very good - we were met at the hotel by the courtesy bus, the journey was a short one (yes the hotel is on the flight path but the noise did not once disturb us); the reception at the hotel was good, we were given a courtesy drink on arrival, the hotel lobby area is very smart, done in marble with seating areas and the staff (reception and bellboy) were friendly and helpful. The room was really nice with a king size bed and seating area (I suppose a bulk standard hotel room but well decorated etc). Unfortunately on our first day in Dubai my husband's back went and we ended up being in the room for almost the duration of our stay, so we were thankful that it was such a nice room! During this time the hotel staff were exceptional. They called out a doctor and phoned up when he had gone to see if we needed them to send someone out for the medicine, the restaurant staff send breakfast to the room for us each day (breakfast is usually a buffet with freshly cooked eggs, pancakes, waffles) and the reception staff helped us with contacting our holiday rep, rearranging flights etc. I can only say that the hotel was absolutely first class and we could not have been in a better place for something like that to happen. I would thoroughly recommend the Marco Polo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value, Never Again, Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Dubai with my wife. We stayed at the Marco Polo hotel from the 1 to 6 May 2006. In South Africa I might have got a bit spoilt with the hotel standards, but Marco Polo hotel Dubai is definitely not 4* by a long shot. The bathrooms are terribly stained and dirty. When I checked in, there was actually hair in the toilet and bath. I find the hygiene to be pathetic. The staff are friendly but that doesnt make much of a difference when you in the room alot. I would not reccomend anyone to stay at this hotel. As a frequent traveller to Dubai, I can easily tell you to please stay away from this unfortunate excuse for a 4*. Take my word for it.

HotelInfo.Name: Marco Polo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Muteena St | PO Box 25570, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
